exceptions.description: Monday, September 22nd, Aguilar Library will have a delayed opening of 12 noon, remaining open until 6pm.

locations.name: Belmont Library and Enrico Fermi Cultural Center

exceptions.description:
The Cathedral Library closed temporarily, beginning on January 6th, 2014, to facilitate necessary repairs to the building's facade. The branch is scheduled to reopen in early, 2015. During this temporary closure, we encourage you to visit the following nearby branches:

*58th Street Library, 127 East 58th Street (between Park & Lexington Aves.)
*Grand Central Library, 135 East 46th Street (between Lexington & Third Aves.)

During the time your hold requests can be picked up at Grand Central Library at 135 East 46th Street (between Lexington & Third Aves.); Grand Central Library can be reached at (212) 621-0670.
The Donnell Library is expected to reopen Winter 2015.
Closed for heat and hot water repairs on Saturday, September 20, 2014
Visit our Teen Corner. Every month a young adult author will be featured along with swag giveaways. See staff for details. Supplies are limited.

The 125th Street Branch Library is temporarily closed to facilitate branch improvements. For the duration of the closing, items requested for pickup at 125th Street will instead be delivered to the nearby Harlem Branch, located at 9 West 124th Street. You may select an alternate pickup location for any items not already arrived or in transit to the Harlem Branch Library.
*Children's section closes 15 minutes prior to branch closing
Please note our accessible lift is out of order and will be repaired shortly.  Sincere apologies for any inconvenience!

The Mosholu Branch will be closed on Saturday-September 20, 2014 for necessary electrical work.
The outdoor drop box will remain open for returning materials.

locations.cross_street: near E. 8th St. - St. Marks Place
locations.name: Ottendorfer Library

exceptions.description:
The Rose Main Reading Room and the Bill Blass Public Catalog Room in the Stephen A. Schwarzman Building will be temporarily closed. More information is available on the updates page.

General Research Division (GRD) onsite materials are still available for use in the Stephen A. Schwarzman Building. We encourage you to submit requests in advance of your visit via our online form.

Otherwise, you may request GRD materials in Room 217 or in any of the Schwarzman Building’s other reading rooms.

For offsite requests, please consult our Classic Catalog and submit your request for any item by clicking the gray Request From Off-Site Storage button in the catalog record. Materials will be available for pickup in Room 217.

Laptop computers are available for use in place of our desktop computers. If you prefer to use desktops, you can visit the Mid-Manhattan Library across Fifth Avenue at the corner of 40th Street.

locations.cross_street: at Ocean Ave. & Father Capodanno Blvd.
locations.name: South Beach Library

exceptions.description: Our Research Divisions have various hours. To see their operating hours, please click here: Research Collections. The exhibition galleries and The Gift Shop are OPEN Monday—Saturday.

locations.name: Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture

exceptions.description: Many of SIBL's research collections are stored offsite. Check in the "Classic Catalog" to determine availability and  request materials in advance of your visit.
The Van Cortlandt Branch will be closed to facilitate branch improvements from Monday September 22 through Friday September 26. The branch will re-open Saturday, September 27

The Woodstock Library will be closed from September 1, 2014 until late 2016 for an extensive renovation. During this period we encourage you to visit the following branches: Morrisania Library at 610 East 169th Street, Melrose Library at 910 Morris Avenue and the Hunt's Point Library at 877 Southern Boulevard. Hold requests that are received while we close may be picked up at the Hunt's Point Library located at 877 Southern Boulevard. To select another location, login to your account online or speak to a library staff member.
